summary: The document comprises records from the Assassination Records Review Board, focusing on the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA) staff payroll records. It details the status of documents, reasons for their postponement, and specifics of payroll authorizations for Floyd L. Reeves, appointed as a Staff Investigator for the Martin Luther King, Jr. Task Force. Additionally, it includes memoranda on payroll certifications and the disclosure of any relationships to Members of Congress.
key_findings: Partial postponement of the document was due to the inclusion of Social Security numbers, with redactions implemented to safeguard personal privacy.
Floyd L. Reeves was appointed as a Staff Investigator for the Martin Luther King, Jr. Task Force with a starting salary of $24,000, effective August 1, 1977.

The document underscores the procedural elements of payroll authorization and certification in the U.S. House of Representatives, including the necessity to reveal any connections to current Members of Congress.
keywords: Martin Luther King, Jr. Task Force
